title: Agave Margarita
description: Tequila and cannabis … what could go wrong?
directions: In a shaker filled with ice, combine the tequila, aquavit, lime juice, agave syrup, green juice, salt and cannabis tincture.
Shake, then fine strain into a lowball glass with one large ice cube.
Garnish with a cannabis leaf, edible flowers or your favorite greens.
Serve immediately.

title: Almond Milk
description: The perfect drink for any health nut!
directions: Blend almonds and water in a food processor until it resembles milk.
Strain the almond milk through a cheesecloth or strainer.
Add the strained milk to a saucepan and bring to a light boil.
Add the ground cannabis and reduce heat. Simmer for about 2 hours, stir frequently.
Remove from heat. Chill and serve.

title: Apple Parmesan Risotto
description: An interesting twist on classic risotto. This recipe pairs great as a side dish with fish or chicken.
directions: Place stock in a medium saucepan, bring to a boil, lower heat and keep warm.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pancetta or bacon and cook until it starts to brown.
Add onions and garlic and sauté until softened, about 2 minutes.
Add rice and cook, stirring constantly, until starting to toast, about 2 minutes more.
Add vermouth or white wine and stir to deglaze the pan. Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated.
Stir in apples and parsley.

Lower heat to medium and begin adding the stock to the skillet, one ladle at a time.

(note) - Make sure to cook and stir between each addition, until almost all of the previous addition has evaporated before adding more. When all the stock has been incorporated, the rice should be creamy and tender.
Stir in nutmeg.
Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan, CannaButter, and butter until melted and well combined.
Cover and let sit for 5 minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper, stir and serve.

title: Baked French Toast
description: Grandma`s old fashioned recipe, with a contemporary twist.
directions: Lightly butter a 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Cut the baguette across into 8 even slices; each should be about ¾ inch thick.
Using a small bowl, cream both butters together until thoroughly combined.
Spread the combined butter onto a single side of each of the 8 slices and arrange each slice butter side up in the prepared baking dish.
Whisk together the eggs, sugar, milk, syrup, vanilla and salt. Pour the mixture over the bread and press the slices down into it before covering the dish. Refrigerate for 8 hours.
When ready to cook, preheat your oven to 350°F.
Once the oven is heated, place the uncovered baking dish in the oven and bake for 45 minutes.
Dust the finished French toast with powdered sugar and serve while hot.

title: Baked Italian Eggplant
description: This traditional Italian dish pairs great with your favorite wine. For an extra kick add some crushed red pepper!
directions: Heat the cannabis-infused olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.Add the garlic, bell pepper and onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.

Add the Italian sausages, and cook, turning as needed, until golden, about 8 minutes more. Then add the sliced mushrooms and sauté this mixture until the mushrooms reduce in volume, 5 more minutes.Add the Italian seasoning and fennel and cook 3 minutes more.
Add the tomato paste and cook 2 minutes.Add the red wine reduce for 2 minutes, then add 1½ cups water.

Stir this mixture on low on the stove top until well-combined, about 5 minutes. Let this mixture simmer on low for 45 minutes. After the 45 minutes are up, remove the Italian sausages, transfer to a serving platter and keep warm. Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

Heat the oven to 375°F. Spread half of the sauce mixture and sprinkle half the mozzarella cheese onto the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Lay the sliced eggplant down evenly allowing for overlapping and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Spoon the remaining sauce and sprinkle the remaining mozzarella cheese over the eggplant slices.Cover the baking dish with tinfoil.Bake for 55 minutes.
Remove the tinfoil and sprinkle the shredded Parmesan cheese over the dish. Bake for another 5 minutes, then remove the dish from the oven to serve. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

title: Baked Lemon Chicken
description: Looking to get lifted while still eating healthy, then this is your dish.
directions: Preheat oven to 400°F and grease a baking sheet or large casserole dish.
Melt CannaButter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 2-3 minutes on each side just until browned. Transfer chicken to a prepared baking sheet.
In a small bowl, whisk together chicken broth, lemon juice, honey, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper.
Pour sauce over chicken. Bake 20-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Every 5-10 minutes spoon the sauce from the pan over the chicken.
Garnish with fresh rosemary and lemon slices, if desired, and serve.

title: Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins
description: Enjoy these sweet and fluffy muffins as a tasty treat or with some coffee. But be careful, their potency will creep up on you!
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line twelve ⅓ cup muffin cups with paper or foil muffin liners. Or alternately grease and flour 12 muffin tin cups.
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a small bowl, set aside.
In a large bowl, use a potato masher or the back of a large spoon to mash the ripe bananas.

Add egg, milk, melted CannaButter and butter to the mashed bananas and mix with a large spoon until all ingredients are well incorporated.

(optional-Replace the regular butter with CannaButter if you desire an increase in the potency of the muffins.
Stir the dry ingredients into the bowl until combined, do not over mix.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Divide the mixture between the 12 muffin cups and sprinkle the tops with the coarse raw sugar.

Bake for about 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out without cake crumbs. Cool on a wire rack.

(note) - If you plan to freeze, cool completely before wrapping and labeling.

title: Banana-Zucchini Bread
description: A sweet, healthy, and satisfying snack for any occasion.
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, whisk CannaFlour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, bananas, sugar and oil.Add to dry mixture and stir just until moistened.Fold in zucchini and pecans.
Pour batter into 2 greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pans.Bake until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 45-50 minutes.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

title: Belgian Waffles
description: The perfect dish to combine your dream of breakfast and cannabis. Start your day off right.
directions: Preheat your waffle iron before starting to mix the batter.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Make a well in the middle. Break the eggs into the well and beat lightly with a fork. Add the oil and CannaMilk and stir until moistened.

Using a spoon, put the batter into your waffle maker and cook until golden and crispy.

(optional) - Add cannabis-infused maple syrup.

title: Blazing Breakfast Sandwiches
description: Step up your morning breakfast routine with this quick, easy and delicious recipe.
directions: In a large frying pan, cook the bacon and then the eggs.
Spread 1 tbsp of CannaButter evenly across each slice of bread.
Assemble the sandwich in the following order: 1 slice of bread, 1 slice of cheese, 1 slice of bacon, scrambled eggs, 1 slice of bacon, 1 slice of cheese and the other slice of bread.

Press the sandwich together and carefully fry it in the same large pan as before.

(note) - Cook the sandwich on a medium-low heat, until all the cheese has melted.

title: Bloody Mary
description: This classic Bloody Mary recipe is the ideal way to start off your Sunday.
directions: Squeeze ¼ cup lemon juice. Add horseradish, Worcestershire and Sriracha.
Pour in 4 oz tomato juice. Add pinch of salt and pepper. Add 1 clove of finely chopped garlic. Stir in 2 oz cannabis-infused bacon fat.
Pour 2 oz of CannaVodka into an empty glass. Add ice cubes. Pour in Bloody Mary mix. Shake vigorously.
Rub lemon along the rim of a clean glass. Rub the rim in celery salt. Pour in finished Bloody Mary and garnish.

title: Blueberries & Cream Coffee Cake
description: Start your morning off right with an amazing coffee cake! Compliment this recipe with a cannabis-infused coffee and a good book.
directions: In a large bowl, cream CannaButter and sugar until light and fluffy, 5-7 minutes.Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla.

Combine the CannaFlour, baking powder and salt. Add to the creamed mixture, along with sour cream.Fold in blueberries.

(note) - When adding to the creamed mixture, alternate between adding some of the dry mixture and some of the sour cream. Make sure to beat well after each addition.
Spoon half of batter into a greased and floured 10-inch fluted tube pan or two 5-inch cake pans.

In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar and cinnamon.

(optional) - Add pecans to mixture in the small bowl.
Sprinkle half the brown sugar mixture over the batter.
Top the sprinkled batter with the remaining batter.

Sprinkle the remaining brown sugar mixture across the top of the batter.

(note) - Cut through batter with a knife to swirl the brown sugar mixture.
Bake at 350°F until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean, 55-60 minutes.

Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

(optional) - Just before serving, dust with powdered sugar.

title: Blueberry Cobbler
description: Enjoy the sweet flavor of blueberry with this classic southern recipe.
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a small bowl, cream CannaButter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat well.
In another bowl, combine the CannaFlour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture alternately with milk, beating well after each addition. Fold in blueberries.
Spread into greased 9 x 9 inch baking pan.
In a small bowl, combine the sugar, flour and cinnamon. Cut in CannaButter until mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle over blueberry mixture.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 40-45 minutes.

Cool on a wire rack.

(optional) - Serve topped with whipped cream and additional blueberries.

title: Brie-Stuffed Pretzel Bites
description: Buttery cannabis-infused pretzel dough stuffed with creamy Brie cheese.
directions: Fit an electric mixer with the dough hook attachment. In the mixer bowl, combine the flour with the sugar, yeast and salt for about 30 seconds.
Add 1¼ cups warm water and the melted CannaButter, and mix on low speed for 3 minutes.
Increase to medium speed and mix for 4 minutes more.
Transfer the dough to a lightly greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let the dough rise until it has nearly doubled in size, about 1-1½ hours.

Divide the dough into 40 even pieces. Divide the Brie into 40 pieces.

(note) - The Brie pieces should be small, about 1 tsp each.
Press each piece of dough flat and place a piece of Brie in the center. Roll the dough around the Brie and pinch well to seal on all sides.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
Combine 8 cups water and baking soda in a large pot and heat over medium heat until the baking soda is fully dissolved.
Dip each pretzel bite into the baking-soda water for about 30 seconds. Transfer the pretzels to the prepared baking sheets, seam side down.
In a small bowl, whisk the egg with 1 tbsp water to combine. Brush the egg wash generously over each piece and then garnish with coarse salt.
Bake until the bites are golden brown, 15-20 minutes. Let cool at least 10 minutes and serve warm.

title: Broccoli Quiche with Kief
description: This recipe is great for large breakfast or brunch groups!
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Over medium-low heat melt CannaButter in a large saucepan. Add onions, garlic and broccoli.
Cook slowly, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are soft. Spoon vegetables into the pie crust and sprinkle with cheese.
Combine eggs, milk and kief. Season with salt and pepper.Stir in melted butter. Pour egg mixture over vegetables and cheese.
Bake in preheated oven for 30-50 minutes, or until center has set.

title: Buffalo Wings
description: What is every football party missing-more cannabis! Spice up your next party and show everyone how to really enjoy the game.
directions: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to 375°F.
Combine flour, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and paprika in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and milk.
Dip each piece of chicken in the egg mixture, and then roll in the flour blend. Do this twice so that each piece of chicken is double-coated.
Refrigerate breaded chicken for 20 minutes.
Fry chicken in the hot oil. Cook until the exterior is golden brown, and the juices run clear, this should take around 5-6 minutes.
Combine hot sauce and butter in a small saucepan. Heat sauce on medium until melted. Pour sauce over the cooked chicken; mix to coat.

title: Caesar Salad
description: Crisp Romaine lettuce paired with homemade cannabis-infused caesar dressing. Spice this recipe up by adding some grilled chicken.
directions: Mince 3 cloves of garlic, and combine in a small bowl with mayonnaise, anchovies, 2 tbsp of the Parmesan cheese, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and lemon juice.
Add the CannaOil to the mixture.
Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Refrigerate the cannabis-infused caesar dressing until ready to use.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cut the remaining 3 cloves of garlic into quarters. Cook and stir until brown, and then remove garlic from pan.
Add bread cubes to the pan and cook, turning frequently, until lightly browned. Remove bread cubes from oil, and season with salt and pepper.
Place lettuce in a large bowl. Toss with dressing, remaining Parmesan cheese and seasoned bread cubes.
Add cannabis-infused caesar dressing over the top of your salad.
Serve the salad immediately.

title: Café de Cannabis
description: A little taste of Havana with a sweet sativa tone.
directions: After brewing a fresh cup of Cuban espresso, mix in the sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Stir until completely combined.
Mix in the decarboxylated cannabis until completely combined.
Add milk or enjoy dark. Serve immediately.

title: Cannabis Omelet
description: Start your next morning off right with a medicated omelet. Remember to spice it up with some cayenne peppers.
directions: Preheat stove at high-medium heat.
Grease a frying pan with CannaButter and place on element.
Beat eggs and add to pan.
While the eggs cook, dice the meat you selected.

Once the eggs have solidified enough on the bottom to flip without breaking, place all the filling ingredients in the center of the eggs. Flip one half of the omelet over to cover the fillings.

(optional) - Add diced cayenne peppers to spice up the omelet

Cook until fillings are cooked thoroughly.

(note) - Make sure all the cheese has melted.

title: Canna Carrot Cake
description: Carrot cake just like grandma used to make. Enjoy this classic recipe with a tall glass of CannaMilk.
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a 10-inch fluted tube pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together CannaFlour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, canola oil, eggs, and vanilla extract until well blended. Gradually combine dry mixture. Stir in carrots and walnuts.
Transfer to the prepared tube pan.Bake until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 50-60 minutes.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to completely cool.
For frosting, beat cannabis cream cheese and CannaButter until smooth. Gradually beat in powdered sugar. Spread over cake.

title: Canna Mushroom Soup
description: Savory garlic soup topped with cannabis-infused shiitake mushrooms.
directions: Place the shiitake mushrooms with the CannaButter in a pan over medium heat. Cook until tender, then drain everything aside.
Sauté the onion in olive oil for 5 minutes over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and heat for an extra 1 minute.

Add the vegetable broth and the cream. Bring to boil and stir thoroughly to combine all the ingredients.

(note) - To thicken the soup, add more flour.
After about 2 minutes, pour the soup into bowls and add the cannabis-infused mushrooms.
Finish by topping the soup with some salt, pepper, and coriander.

title: CannaBanana Bread
description: A special twist on an American classic. You have never enjoyed banana bread like this.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, stir together the melted CannaButter and white sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla, mix well.
Combine the flour, baking soda and salt, stir it into the CannaButter mixture until it`s smooth. Next, fold in the sour cream, walnuts and sliced bananas. Spread evenly into the prepared loaf pan.
In the preheated oven, bake it at 350°F for about 60 minutes. You can use a toothpick that`s inserted into the center of the loaf; when it comes out clean it`s ready.
Cool loaf in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to allow it to cool completely.

title: CannaButter
description: The staple product for cooking most cannabis edibles. With CannaButter you can create some amazing special recipes.
directions: Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes, taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.

Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder.

(note) - This baked cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.
Heat the butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the baked cannabis and cook, taking care not to let the temperature go over 200°F for about 45 minutes.

Remove from heat and let sit, undisturbed, for 10 minutes, before straining through a colander lined with cheesecloth, set over a bowl. Press carefully with a spoon to extract as much butter as possible.

(note) - The CannaButter will keep, covered and refrigerated, for up to 8 weeks.

title: CannaCaramels
description: These aren`t your grandma`s caramels…
directions: Lightly oil a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan, then line the bottom and at least halfway up the sides with parchment paper.
Place cream in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat, add CannaButter and regular butter, heat until butters are melted. Gently stir to combine well.
Stir in sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup and salt until combined. Place lid on the pot and cook for 1 minute.

Remove lid and attach a candy thermometer to the pan. Cook without stirring until the mixture reaches 245°F, then immediately remove from heat and quickly stir in nuts and vanilla. Pour mixture into the prepared pan.

Let stand until cool.

(note) - Place in fridge to speed up the cooling process.
After the caramels cool, use parchment paper to remove caramels from pan. Cut into 4 rows by 9 columns to make 36 individual candies.

title: CannaChapulín
description: Taste the flavor of Mexico with every sip of this amazing green cocktail.
directions: Muddle the cilantro.
Add the agave nectar, juice, CannaTequila and CannaMezcal. Muddle the mixture.
Add ice.
Shake, strain and garnish with a lime peel.

title: CannaCream
description: A staple for any cannabis connoisseur who is serious about baking edibles.
directions: Heat heavy cream and ground cannabis in double boiler over medium heat.
Simmer for at least 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Remove the boiler from the heat and let the mixture cool.
Prepare a storage container by taking 2 sheets of the cheese cloth and securing it over the lid of the container.
Pour the cream slowly over the top of the cheesecloth and into the container.
After a few minutes pour the cream into an airtight container and store in the refrigerator until cold.
Serve and enjoy. Keep refrigerated.

title: CannaFlour
description: Turn your next baking creation up to 1000! This infusion is perfect for those who have excess shake, stalks, and leaves.
ingredientsNote: Utilize parts of the plant that would usually be tossed out to decrease cost.
directions: Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet. If you are adding stalks and leaves, try to separate them.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes (stirring every 10 minutes), taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.
Remove the cannabis to cool.
Grind your cannabis in a food processor or blender until super fine.
Store in an airtight container in a dark, cool place.

title: CannaGin
description: With this quick and simple recipe you can make cannabis-infused gin and juice a reality.
directions: Preheat the oven to 240ºF.

Decarboxylate your cannabis by spreading it evenly across a cookie sheet. Place aluminum foil over the top of the cannabis.

(note) - Break your cannabis up in to relatively small chunks to help the decarboxylation process.
Place tray into the oven for 25-45 minutes. Take it out and let it cool.
Grind the cannabis and wrap it in cheesecloth.
Place the cheesecloth package in a 1 L sealable jar, then add the gin.

Shake the bottle and let it sit, in the dark, for at least 48 hours. Shake it up at least once a day until it has reached your desired potency—up to one month, if possible.

(note) - The longer it sits, the more potent it will be.

Pour the gin mixture into a glass container, using a cheesecloth to strain out any ground cannabis from the gin.

(note) - Discard the plant material.
Store in 1 L sealable jar.

title: CannaMayo
description: A classic condiment infused with the wonderful essence of the cannabis plant.
directions: Whisk egg yolk, lemon juice, salt, vinegar and mustard together.
Slowly add CannaOil while whisking.

Whisk until the mayonnaise begins to thicken.

(note) - Add a few drops of water if the mayonnaise mixture gets too thick.
Store mayonnaise in an airtight container. Chill in the refrigerator.

title: CannaMezcal
description: Not quite as crazy as tequila, this cannabis-infused alcohol will still have you in for a wild night.
directions: Preheat the oven to 240ºF.

Decarboxylate your cannabis by spreading it evenly across a cookie sheet. Place aluminum foil over the top of the cannabis.

(note) - Break your cannabis up in to relatively small chunks to help the decarboxylation process.
Place tray into the oven for 25-45 minutes. Take it out and let it cool.
Grind the cannabis and wrap it in cheesecloth.
Place the cheesecloth package in a 1 L sealable jar, then add the mezcal.

Shake the bottle and let it sit, in the dark, for at least 48 hours. Shake it up at least once a day until it has reached your desired potency—up to one month, if possible.

(note) - The longer it sits, the more potent it will be.

Pour the mezcal mixture into a glass container, using a cheesecloth to strain out any ground cannabis from the mezcal.

(note) - Discard the plant material.
Store in 1 L sealable jar.

title: CannaMilk
description: Perfect to pair with some cookies, pour into your morning cereal, or make a protein shake.
directions: Heat the oven to 250° F. Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes, taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.
Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder. This baked cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.
Heat the milk in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the baked cannabis and cook, taking care not to let the temperature go over 200°F for about 45 minutes.

Remove from heat and let sit, undisturbed, for 10 minutes, before straining through a colander lined with cheesecloth, set over a bowl. Press carefully with a spoon to extract as much milk as possible.

(note) - The CannaMilk will keep, covered and refrigerated, for up to 8 weeks.

title: CannaOil
description: An essential utility for all serious cannabis connoisseurs.
directions: Heat the oven to 250°F.Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes, taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.
Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder. This baked cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.
Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the baked cannabis and cook, taking care not to let the temperature go over 200°F for about 45 minutes.

Remove from heat and let sit, undisturbed, for 10 minutes, before straining through a colander lined with cheesecloth, set over a bowl. Press carefully with a spoon to extract as much oil as possible.

(note) - The CannaOil will keep, covered and refrigerated, for up to 8 weeks.

title: CannaSazerac
description: A sweet flavored adult beverage, with a strong whiskey flavor.
directions: Dose the sugar cube with bitters. Crush it into the bottom of the glass.
Add water.
In a mixing glass, stir the Weed Whiskey with ice and another dash of Peychauds.

Strain into sugar.

(optional) - Add lemon twist.

title: CannaSugar
description: The ideal infusion to be used on any of your next baking creations.
directions: Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes, taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.
Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder. This baked cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.
Reduce the oven to 200°F.
Transfer the cannabis to a jar and cover with the alcohol. Screw the lid on tight and shake every 5 minutes for 20 minutes.
Strain through a cheesecloth set over a bowl, discarding solids.

Mix the alcohol with the CannaSugar and spread into an even layer in a glass 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake, stirring occasionally, until the alcohol has evaporated and the CannaSugar is lightly golden.
After the CannaSugar cools, transfer it to a jar and store in a cool, dark place.

description: Hazelnut spread so good, you won`t be able to put it down!
title: CannaTella
directions: Heat the oven to 350°F and bake the hazelnuts for 12 minutes.

Melt the chocolate over a bain marie.

(bain marie- Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl and heat on top of a pot of hot water.
In a separate mixing bowl, blend the toasted hazelnuts at high speed.
Add CannaOil, cocoa powder, powdered sugar, vanilla extract and salt to mixing bowl.
Blend again.
Now add your melted chocolate to mixing bowl and blend all together.
Sieve CannaTella through a colander lined with cheesecloth, into a bowl.
Jar and store.

title: CannaTequila
description: If you are looking to get crazy, this cannabis-infused tequila recipe will get you there.
directions: Preheat the oven to 240°F.

Decarboxylate your cannabis by spreading it evenly across a cookie sheet. Place aluminum foil over the top of the cannabis.

(note) - Break your cannabis up in to relatively small chucks to help the decarboxylation process.
Place tray into the oven for 25-45 minutes. Take it out and let it cool.
Grind the cannabis and wrap it in cheesecloth.
Place the cheesecloth package in a 1 L sealable jar, then add the tequila.

Shake the bottle and let it sit, in the dark, for at least 48 hours. Shake it up at least once a day until it has reached your desired potency—up to one month, if possible.

(note) - The longer it sits, the more potent it will be.

Pour the tequila mixture into a glass container, using a cheesecloth to strain out any ground cannabis from the tequila.

(note) - Discard the plant material.
Store in 1 L sealable jar.

title: CannaTini
description: For the connoisseur who appreciates their alcohol as much as their cannabis.
directions: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass. Fill with ice.
Stir until thoroughly mixed and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist and/or cannabis leaf.

title: CannaVodka
description: A great cannabis-infused alcohol for almost any occasion. Enjoy this cannabis-infusion in cocktails or take shots.
directions: Preheat the oven to 240°F.

Decarboxylate your cannabis by spreading it evenly across a cookie sheet. Place aluminum foil over the top of the cannabis.

(note) - Break your cannabis up in to relatively small chunks to help the decarboxylation process.
Place tray into the oven for 25-45 minutes. Take it out and let it cool.
Grind the cannabis and wrap it in cheesecloth.
Place the cheesecloth package in a 1 L sealable jar, then add the vodka.

Shake the bottle and let it sit, in the dark, for at least 48 hours. Shake it up at least once a day until it has reached your desired potency—up to one month, if possible.

(note) - The longer it sits, the more potent it will be.

Pour the vodka mixture into a glass container, using a cheesecloth to strain out any ground cannabis from the vodka.

(note) - Discard the plant material.
Store in 1 L sealable jar.

title: Cannabis-infused Bacon Fat
description: Have you ever wondered what to do with any excess bacon fat? Use this unique recipe to utilize all the bacon each time your cook.
directions: Preheat your oven to 240°F.
Place medium sized cannabis chunks evenly on a cookie sheet. Cover with aluminum foil.
Let the cannabis decarboxylate for 40 minutes.

Begin cooking the bacon.

(note) - Strain the fat through a sieve into a mason jar.
Place the decarboxylated cannabis in the jar of bacon fat. Add the sunflower lecithin.
Fill a medium pot with cold water and place your sealed mason jar in it. Turn on the heat and let the cold water come to a simmer.
Let it simmer for 2-3 hours. Continue to fill water in the pan to replace any that evaporates.
After 2-3 hours, use cheesecloth to strain the plant material out of the bacon fat.
Discard the plant material and store the bacon fat in a refrigerator for later use.

title: Cannabis-infused Coconut Oil
description: You can`t go wrong with coconuts and cannabis. This healthy alternative can be used to replace most oils.
directions: Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes, taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.

Place the cannabis in a strong mason jar, add coconut oil.

(optional) - Add 1 tsp of sunflower lecithin.
Place your closed jar in cold water, then let it come to a boil. Boil for 2-3 hours.
Strain through a cheesecloth.
Let it cool.
Jar and store.

title: Cannabis-infused Cream Cheese
description: A staple for anyone serious about cannabis edibles. Perfect for spreading on bread, using in baking recipes, or whatever else you can imagine.
directions: Pour milk and buttermilk into sauce pan. Stir ground cannabis into milk mixture.Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Heat mixture until the temperature reaches 170°F. Keep milk mixture between 170-175°F for 15 minutes.
Pour the mix through cheesecloth to remove the plant waste.

Return milk to pan and wait 15 minutes.

(note) - The mixture should start to separate.
Line a strainer with several layers of cheesecloth and set it inside a large bowl. Pour the mixture through the strainer to collect curds. Discard leftover milk.
Rest the curds on the strainer at room temperature for 2-4 hours.
Remove curds from the cheese cloth and place in blender. Add salt and blend until creamy. Store in refrigerator for later use.

title: Cannabis-infused Honey
description: If bears knew about this version of honey, we would be in trouble …
directions: Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes, taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.

Every 10 minutes, gently mix the buds with a light shake of the tray to expose the surface area of the buds equally.Combine the cannabis and honey in a double boiler to apply gentle heat on the stove top.
Simmer. Maintain low heat and let the mixture simmer for at least 40 minutes. The mixture should never come to a full boil.

Strain the honey. Set a funnel on top of a jar and line it with cheesecloth. Once the honey has cooled off, pour it over the cheesecloth funnel and allow it to strain freely.

(note) - Cannabis-infused honey can be stored in a cool dark area for 1-2 months.

title: Cannabis-infused Olive Oil
description: If you enjoy the classic olive oil and vinegar, this will blow your mind!
directions: Heat the oven to 250° F.Grind up cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

Bake the cannabis for 35-40 minutes, taking care not to let the cannabis go over 250°F and burn.

(note) - If this happens, you can lose potency.

While your cannabis is baking, take a large pot of water and start to heat it.

(note)-Put the mason jar cap on the bottom of the pot so your glass jar can rest on it.
Peel and coarsely chop your garlic or ginger and place them in the jar.
After baking the cannabis in the oven, add it to the jar. Pour olive oil into the jar, making sure to cover all of the product.

Place jar in the warm water for 1-2 hours at a medium-low temperature, approximately 150-200°.

(note) - Use a cooking thermometer to make sure the desired temperature is reached.

After the cannabis and oil have been bound, strain CannaOil using cheesecloth over a strainer.

(note) - It`s very important to keep these oils refrigerated or frozen after use! IF NOT REFRIGERATED OR FROZEN CORRECTLY THE GARLIC OR GINGER IN THE OLIVE OIL CAN PRODUCE BOTULISM!

title: Cannabis-infused Simple Syrup
description: A basic necessity for every bartending, cannabis enthusiast. Great for making quick cocktails with a cannabis kick.
directions: Bring the water to a low boil.
Slowly add the chopped cannabis, stirring frequently.
Next, add the sugar, stirring to dissolve.

Cook for 20 minutes, covered, not allowing the mixture to boil too vigorously.

(note) - If cannabis mixture gets too hot it will lose its potency.
Remove cover and add glycerin.
Continue cooking at a simmer, for 7-8 minutes, stirring constantly. The mixture will thicken.
Allow the syrup to cool.
To store the infusion, strain the syrup through a small strainer and cheese cloth into a storage container.

title: Caramel Popcorn
description: The ideal snack for movie night. Be careful, sweet and salty is a deadly combination.
directions: Preheat your oven to 250°F. Spray a large shallow roasting pan with cooking spray and add popcorn.
In a separate bowl mix brown sugar, corn syrup, CannaButter, and salt in a heavy saucepan.
Stirring constantly, bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil 5 minutes without stirring. Remove from heat. Stir in baking soda and vanilla; mix well.
Pour syrup over warm popcorn, stirring to coat evenly.

Bake for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.

(note) - Keep refrigerated for extended shelf life.

title: Cheeseburger
description: Ground chuck mixed with CannaButter on toasted buns, topped with your favorite vegetables and condiments.
directions: In a large bowl, mix ground beef and CannaButter until just combined.
Divide into 6 portions and create nice round patties. Season the patties generously with salt and pepper.
Preheat the oven to 350°F.

Preheat your cast iron pan and sear the burger 1 minute per side. Do this with all 6 burgers and transfer to an oven tray.

(note) - Keep the remaining fat in the pan for the buns.
Finish the burgers in the oven until medium well.

Take your buns and cut them all in half. Place on an oven tray with the insides facing up. Take the remaining fat that was in the burger pan and brush the inside of your buns with it. Place buns in the oven on 350°F until nicely golden.
Take out your burger patties and place sliced cheese on them. Put back in the oven for 20-30 seconds, until the cheese has melted nicely.
Start building your burger with your choice of vegetables and sauce.

title: Cherry-Almond Granola Bars
description: This great snack is perfect for those on the move. Pack a few of these tasty bars for a high energy snack to meet any occasion.
directions: Line a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with parchment paper.
Melt the CannaButter in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add the oats and toast until fragrant, 1-2 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the oats with the remaining ingredients and mix well to combine.
Press the oat mixture evenly into the prepared pan. Place the pan in the refrigerator or freezer to let the mixture set for 5-10 minutes.

Cut into 12 evenly sized bars and serve.

(note) - The finished bars will keep, stored in an airtight container at room temperature, for up to a week.

title: Chicken Burrito Bowl
description: Impress your friends and family with this delicious Mexican food recipe. Great for parties or small group gatherings.
directions: Slice up the onion into thin strips, then add to a bowl with 1 cup boiling water, 1 cup white wine vinegar, and one tbsp of sugar. Leave for 30 minutes until the onion is pickled, then drain and dry on a cloth.
Cook the rice according to packet instructions. Add lemon juice and stir to combine.
Heat a small amount of vegetable oil in a large frying pan. Add the chicken and fry for 7-10 minutes, until cooked through. Add salt, paprika, cumin, and one tsp of lemon juice.
Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Cover with foil to prevent it from drying out.
Add the sweetcorn and black beans to the pan and cook through until warm, adding a dash of lemon juice.
Make the pico de gallo next by combining: ½ medium red onion, jalapeño pepper, lime juice, and tomatoes in a bowl. Add seasoning to taste.
Make the guacamole by slicing up the avocados, removing the pits, then combining: sour cream, a pinch of salt, and chili flakes in a bowl.
Next, make the Tex Mex sauce. Heat the CannaOil in a small saucepan. Now, add it to a bowl with the hot sauce, CannaButter, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic. Stir well to combine.

Plate everything up separately. You should have a bowl each of pico de gallo, guacamole, cannabis-infused Tex Mex sauce, rice, chicken, black beans with sweetcorn, and pickled onions. Add another bowl for the grated cheese.
Serve buffet style to allow everyone to add what they want to their own bowls.

title: Chicken Cacciatore
description: Turn your next Italian dinner into a night to remember … unless you have too much cannabis.
directions: Add 1-2 tbsp of CannaOil to a large skillet on low heat. Let this oil heat up for a couple of minutes.
Open your pack of chicken breast and place pieces onto the hot skillet.

Dice the onion and slice the mushrooms, then place both into the skillet with the chicken. Cook the chicken, mushrooms and onion on medium heat for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Add a little salt and pepper to taste.

(note) - You can cover the pan with a lid to retain moisture.

While the chicken and veggies are roasting, in a small-medium saucepan empty your tomato sauce. Add the remainder of the CannaOil to the saucepan. Add finely chopped rosemary and salt and pepper to taste.
Stir this sauce and allow it to reach a light boil. Once hot and ready, place it off to the side.
Once the chicken is done cooking, pour the cannabis-infused tomato sauce over the chicken in the large skillet and mix with a spatula to get it evenly coated with sauce.
Serve immediately.

title: Chicken Quesadilla
description: The perfect munchie food is now an edible! Be careful, these quesadillas are addictive.
directions: Heat a medium skillet over medium heat.Warm your tortilla for about 30 seconds, flipping halfway. Flip once more, then sprinkle one-half of the tortilla with about½ of the cheese.
Cover the cheese evenly with the remaining fillings: beans, bell pepper, onion, ½ tbsp CannaOil, chicken, and jalapeño (if using).
Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the fillings, and fold over the empty side of the tortilla to enclose the fillings.
Quickly brush the top of the quesadilla with light coating of remaining ½ tbsp CannaOil, then carefully flip it with a spatula.

Let the quesadilla cook until golden and crispy on the bottom, about 1 minute. Then, flip it over once more and repeat.

(note) - Reduce the heat if necessary to prevent burning the tortilla.
Transfer the quesadilla to a chopping board and cut into pieces.
Serve immediately.

title: Chocolate CannaBananas
description: A snack like no other. This sweet and simple treat will be your next favorite.
directions: Combine CannaOil or CannaButter and chocolate chips in an oven safe bowl.

Melt the chocolate over a bain marie.

(bain marie- Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl and heat on top of a pot of hot water.
Stir cannabis-infused chocolate until smooth.
Add bananas, and coat well.
Place CannaBananas on parchment paper, dust with sprinkles if desired, and freeze.
Serve once cooled in refrigerator.

title: Chocolate Chess Pie
description: All chocolate lovers have to try this pie. Get medicated, while you indulge your chocolate cravings.
directions: Combine CannaFlour and salt, then cut in ¼cup CannaButter and shortening until crumbly.Gradually add ice water, tossing with a fork until dough holds together when pressed.
Shape dough into a disk. Wrap and refrigerate 1 hour or overnight.
Preheat oven to 425°F.
On a floured surface, roll dough to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Trim and flute edge. Refrigerate 30 minutes.
Bake on a lower oven rack until light golden brown, 15-20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Reduce oven setting to 325°F.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs, sugars, melted chocolate, milk, all-purpose flour and vanilla. Gradually whisk in the remaining ½ cup melted CannaButter. Pour into crust.
Bake at 325°F until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 35-40 minutes.
Remove foil. Cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate, covered, for 3 hours or until chilled.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: The classic American dessert, which will have you coming back for more. Pair with CannaMilk for the ultimate treat.
directions: Preheat oven to 350° F.
Cream CannaButter, white sugar and brown sugar together in a bowl, then beat in eggs. Stir in the vanilla.
Dissolve baking soda in hot water then add to mixture.
In a separate bowl, sift flour and salt; stir into butter mixture. Finally add the chocolate chips.
Get a baking tray & cover it in parchment paper. Place cookies with large spoonfuls of dough on the tray, evenly spaced apart. There should be about 24.

Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned.

(note) - Slightly undercook for soft and gooey cookies.

title: Chocolate Covered Pretzels
description: You can`t go wrong with sweet and salty. The only thing better is sweet, salty, and cannabis.
directions: In a double boiler melt the CannaButter.
Once the CannaButter has melted, sieve in the cocoa powder & powdered sugar.
Stir on low heat until the ingredients have completely mixed together. Mix thoroughly until there is consistency, then turn the heat off but leave the pot on the stove.
Place a pretzel in the cannabis chocolate mixture and push it below the surface with a fork to coat. Carefully remove, shake off any excess chocolate, and place onto a lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate the pretzels until the chocolate is hard, about 1 hour.

title: Chocolate Fudge Brownies
description: The cliche edible for every stoner. Enjoy the rich fudge flavors, while you get lifted.
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with regular butter and line with parchment paper. Grease parchment paper and set pan aside.

Melt the chocolate over a bain marie.

(bain marie- Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl and heat on top of a pot of hot water.
Combine the regular butter and CannaButter with the melted chocolate over a bain marie. Cook, stirring, until melted and smooth, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Whisk the eggs together in a large bowl. Add the sugar, vanilla, and salt and whisk to combine. Stir in the chocolate mixture and fold in the flour.
Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan and bake until the brownie forms a thin skin on top but the batter is still loose in the center, about 18-20 minutes.
Transfer the pan to a rack and let cool completely before slicing.

title: Chocolate Granola
description: Taste the sweet flavors of honey and chocolate in this high energy snack.
directions: Preheat the oven to 325° F.Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, and grease the paper with nonstick cooking spray.

In a medium pot set over low heat, combine the CannaOil with the CannaButter, brown sugar, honey, vanilla, cocoa powder and salt.

(note) - Heat, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is smooth and fully combined.
In a large bowl, toss the oats with the almonds. Add the cocoa mixture and toss to combine.
Divide the mixture evenly between the two baking sheets and spread into an even layer. Bake until toasty and crisp, about 45-60 minutes.
Remove the baking sheets from the oven every 20 minutes or so and toss the granola with a spatula to make sure it is toasting evenly.
Let cool to room temperature and then stir in the chocolate chunks.
Transfer the finished granola to airtight containers.

title: Chocolate Potato Cake
description: Cannabis-infused potato batter mixed with nuts and topped with homemade vanilla icing.
directions: Preheat oven to 350° F.
In a large bowl, cream CannaButter and CannaSugar until light and fluffy. Add 1 egg at a time, beating well after each addition. Add potatoes and vanilla.
Combine the flour, cocoa and baking soda. Gradually add the mixture to the creamed mixture alternately with milk, beating well after each addition. Stir in nuts.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9-inch round baking pans. Bake at 350°F until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 25-30 minutes.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
In a saucepan over low heat, cook remaining CannaButter and brown sugar, until CannaButter is melted and mixture is smooth.
For the icing, stir in evaporated milk and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat; cool to room temperature. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth.
Spread between layers and over top of cake and serve.

title: Chocolate Sauce
description: An easy way to spice up any dessert.
directions:
Melt the chocolate over a bain marie.

(bain marie-Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl and heat on top of a pot of hot water.
Combine the regular butter and CannaButter with the melted chocolate over a bain marie. Cook, stirring, until melted and smooth, about 5 minutes.

Stir in sugar, stirring to combine and incorporate before adding more.

(note) - Slowly add more to avoid clumps.
Slowly stir in the evaporated milk, a little at a time, until everything is completely mixed. Continue to cook and stir until sugar has completely melted and sauce is smooth, about 3 minutes.
Use now for hot cannabis-infused chocolate sauce or cool completely and package in a lidded container and refrigerate. Microwave for about 10 seconds to reheat before using.

title: Churros
description: Fair food on an entirely different level.
directions: In a large mixing bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt, 2 tbsp of sugar and set aside.
Add the cannabis coconut oil along with 1 cup of water to a pan over medium heat, whisk constantly.
Once the water starts to boil, immediately pour it into the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar bowl. Blend this with an electric mixer until it`s consistent.
Add the vanilla extract and keep blending until the dough becomes smooth. Transfer the churro dough to a piping bag.

Pour the 32 oz of oil into a high-sided skillet over medium-high heat until it reaches 375°F. Squeeze out a 6-inch strip of churro dough directly into the oil and fry for about 2 minutes until the churros are golden brown.

Once the churros are cooked, remove them from the oil using tongs.

(note) - Place cooked churros onto a plate lined with paper towels to soak up excess oil.
Combine 4 cups of sugar and cinnamon in a large zip lock bag. Set aside.
Once the churros are cooked, let them cool down. Add the churros to the bag and shake lightly allowing the churros to be completely coated in the cinnamon sugar.

title: Cinnamon Rolls
description: A twist on a European classic that will have you wanting more than just one.
directions:
Add warm CannaMilk to the bowl of an electric mixer and sprinkle yeast on top.

(note) - You will know if the yeast has activated if it begins to foam after a few minutes. If it has not, then start over; your CannaMilk was either too hot or too cold.
Once yeast begins to foam, add in sugar, egg, egg yolk and CannaButter. Mix until well combined. Next, stir in flour and salt with a wooden spoon until a dough begins to form.

Place dough hook on the mixer and knead the dough on medium speed for 8 minutes. The dough should form into a nice ball and be slightly sticky.

(note) - If you don`t want to use an electric mixer, you can use your hands to knead the dough for 8-10 minutes on a well-floured surface.
Transfer dough ball to a well-oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap and a warm towel. Allow dough to rise for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.

After the dough has doubled in size, transfer the dough to a well-floured surface and roll out into a 9 x 14 inch rectangle. Spread softened CannaButter over dough, leaving a ¼ inch margin at the far side of the dough.
In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar and cinnamon. Use your hands to sprinkle mixture over the buttered dough.
Tightly roll dough up, starting from the 9 inch side and place seam side down making sure to seal the edges of the dough as best you can.
Cut into 1 inch sections with a serrated knife or floss. You should get 9 large pieces.
Grease a 9 x 9 inch backing pan or round 9 inch cake pan. Line the pan with parchment paper to catch any filling that leaks out.
Place cinnamon rolls in the pan. Cover with plastic wrap and a warm towel and let rise again for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F.

Remove plastic wrap and towel and bake cinnamon rolls for 20-25 minutes or until just slightly golden brown on the edges.\n\n(note) - Underbake the cinnamon rolls a little so they stay soft in the middle.
Allow them to cool for 5 minutes before frosting.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine cream cheese, CannaButter, powdered sugar and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth and fluffy. Spread over cinnamon rolls and serve immediately.

title: Citrus Berry Trifles
description: A simple, yet elegant dish for your next brunch. These delicious dairy desserts are sure to impress your friends!
directions: Preheat oven to 350° F.
Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch baking sheet. In a small bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

In large bowl with an electric mixer, cream CannaButter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, 1 at a time, then ½ tsp lemon extract, ½ tsp lemon zest, and yogurt. Lower mixer speed and mix in dry ingredients until just combined. Pour into greased half sheet pan and smooth out into one even layer.\n\n(note) - Scrape edges and mix by hand to ensure batter is evenly mixed.
Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Set aside to cool 30 minutes.
Prepare the lemon cream by whipping together the heavy cream, powdered sugar, and lemon extract until stiff peaks start to form. After you see the peaks begin to form, whip in the lemon zest.

To assemble the trifles, turn the container you will serving the dish in upside-down and press out the cookie with the top of the container. Continue with this cookie cutting until you create 20 circles from the baked cake.

Press 1 cake circle into the bottom of each of the 10 half-pint jars. Add a layer of fruit, followed by a layer of cream, then another cake circle, more berries, and more cream. Garnish with a few fresh berries on top and serve.

(note) - If making ahead, cover with jar lid and refrigerate until serving time.

title: Coffee
description: Nothing beats the aroma of coffee and cannabis in the morning.
directions: Preheat your oven to 245° F.
Grind the cannabis, put it into a small oven-safe bowl and add the coconut oil. Cover the bowl with foil and place it in the oven for 20 minutes.
Remove the bowl from the oven and strain the oil with cheesecloth to rid it of plant matter.
Add the cannabis coconut oil to the coffee and serve with cannabis-infused coffee creamer, to taste.

title: Cookies & Cream Cheesecake
description: Cookies, cheesecake, and cannabis … can it get any better?
directions: Preheat oven to 330° F.
Place 16 of the cookies in resealable plastic bag. Flatten bag to remove excess air, then seal bag. Crush cookies by rolling a rolling pin across the bag.

Place crushed cookies in a medium bowl. Add regular butter and CannaButter, mix well. Press firmly onto bottom of 9 inch springform pan.

(optional) - Replace the regular butter with CannaButter if you desire an increase in the potency of the cheesecake.
Beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating just until blended.
Chop or crush remaining 8 cookies. Gently stir half of the chopped cookies into cream cheese batter. Pour batter over prepared crust. Sprinkle top of batter with the remaining cookies.
Bake 45 minutes or until center is almost set. Let cool. Refrigerate overnight.

title: Doughnut Holes
description: The perfect bite-sized snack from your childhood made to meet your adult standards.
directions: In a medium bowl, mix the flour, ¼ cup sugar, baking powder, and salt.

In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, combine milk, CannaButter, regular butter, vanilla, and egg. Add in the dry ingredients and mix until a sticky dough forms.

(optional) - Replace the regular butter with CannaButter if you desire an increase in the potency of the doughnut holes.
Heat 4-inches oil in a 1½ gallon saucepan until a deep-fry thermometer reads 350°F.

Working in batches, roll about ½ oz batter into a loose, sticky ball; carefully slide into oil and fry, turning often, until puffed and golden, 2-3 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer doughnut holes to a baking sheet with a wire rack.
Repeat with remaining dough.
Let doughnuts cool completely before tossing in remaining sugar to coat.

title: Doughnuts
description: What is more iconic than coffee and doughnuts? Coffee, cannabis, and doughnuts!
directions: Preheat oven to 350° F and lightly grease your doughnuts pans.
Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.

In a separate bowl, combine, eggs, milk, CannaButter, regular butter, and vanilla extract.

(optional) - Replace the regular butter with CannaButter if you desire an increase in the potency of the doughnuts.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fill doughnuts pan ¾ full (about 3 tbsp each), and spread the batter into an even layer.

Bake for 15-17 minutes.

(note) - The doughnuts are ready when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

To release doughnuts from the pan, let them cool slightly, turn pan over and beat it gently on the table.

Powdered Sugar Doughnuts — add about ⅓ cup of powdered sugar into a paper lunch bag. Toss doughnuts in the bag one at a time until they are coated evenly with powdered sugar.

Cinnamon Sugar Doughnuts — melt 2 tbsp CannaButter and 2 tbsp of unsalted butter in a small bowl. In a separate bowl, mix together your cinnamon and sugar. Dip both sides of the doughnuts in the butter and then both sides in the cinnamon sugar.

Glazed Doughnuts — whisk together 2 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup milk and 1 tsp vanilla extract, until smooth. Set doughnuts on cooling rack and drizzle glaze over with a spoon.

title: Fettuccine Alfredo Pasta
description: Enjoy this creamy classic with a pairing of your favorite wine.
directions: With the large pot, bring lightly salted water to a boil.Then add the dry pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes or until ready, drain the pot.
In a large saucepan, melt the CannaButter and cream on low heat. Then add your salt, pepper and garlic salt.
Stir in the cheese over medium heat until it`s melted.
Add the pasta to the sauce. Make sure to use all the sauce and ensure the pasta is entirely coated.

title: Fish & Chips
description: Tasty fish covered in a cannabis-infused batter with homemade wedge cut french fries.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350˚ F.
Peel the potatoes and then cut them into desired french fry shape. Place the fries in a bowl of lightly salted water and set aside.
Mix ½ a tsp of salt and 1 tsp of pepper together and rub it on both sides of the fish fillet to remove moisture.

Combine the flour, baking powder, salt and pepper in a mixing bowl, and stir together. Add in the CannaMilk and egg and whisk until the mixture is stiff and smooth.\n\n(note) - You may need to let it stand for up to 20 minutes.
Pour the oil into a large pan or deep fat fryer and heat it to 375˚F.
Cover the fish in the batter and fry in the oil until it is golden brown. Then, take out the fillets and place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Place in the oven for a few minutes to finish cooking, while you make the fries.
Drain the potatoes and dry them on a paper towel. Then, fry in the same oil you cooked the fish in at 350˚F.
Drain the fries on a paper towel again, then season with salt. Take the fish out of the oven and serve.

title: French 75
description: The most classy way to consume your cannabis and alcohol.
directions: Combine first three ingredients in shaker with ice.Shake hard for ten seconds and strain into a champagne flute.
Top with a few ounces of Champagne or sparkling wine and garnish with a lemon twist.

title: French Fries
description: Satisfy your cannabis cravings and munchies all in one snack.
directions: Preheat your oven to 400° F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Cut the peeled potatoes into desired shapes and spread them evenly on the baking sheet.
Drizzle the CannaOil over them and season with salt. Try to coat each fry relatively evenly with the oil so that there is a consistent potency.
Cook the fries until they are golden brown. Around 15-20 minutes.
Allow the fries to cool down, around 5 minutes.
Divide the fries into equal proportions and serve.

title: Fudge
description: For those chocolate lovers out there, this is a must have! Serve with some CannaMilk for the perfect treat.
directions: Spray 8 x 8 inch baking pan lightly with cooking oil.
Put all ingredients into a microwave safe mixing bowl. Cook on high for 5 minutes, stopping to stir once or twice. Stir well.
Pour mixture into prepared pan.
Once the fudge has cooled, cut it into 24 equal sized pieces.

title: Ganja Jerk Chicken
description: Why grill regular chicken when you can infuse it with cannabis!
directions:
Preheat grill to 350-400 ºF.

(note) - Make sure the temperature does not exceed 400 ºF. If the temperature goes over 400 ºF, the cannabis will vaporize and you will no longer have infused chicken.
In a large bowl, mix the jerk chicken marinade, CannaOil, and cannabis-infused honey. Add each piece of chicken to the bowl, completely covering the chicken with the marinade and set aside.
Now grill chicken until any liquid coming out of the chicken is clear.

title: Garlic Parmesan Pasta
description: A simple, yet tasty twist on an Italian dish everyone loves.
directions: Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.Add the garlic and cook until light brown, 3-5 minutes.Remove from the heat and set aside.
Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, about 5 minutes. Drain it, reserving ½ cup pasta water.
Return the pasta to the pot you cooked it in and add the garlic, butter, salt, and pepper.
With a large fork and spoon combine the ingredients well, then add ½ cup of the grated Parmesan cheese and the pasta water and continue to combine gently.
Transfer the pasta to a large platter and top it with the remaining Parmesan cheese.

title: Gingerbread Cake with Caramel Sauce
description: For those with a sweet tooth, this cake will satisfy your every craving.
directions: In a large bowl, cream CannaButter and sugar until light and fluffy.Beat in molasses and egg until well blended.
In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon and salt. Add this mixture to the creamed mixture alternately with ¾ cup water.

Transfer to a greased 9 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake at 325°F for 35-40 minutes.

(note) - Continue to bake the cake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Once the toothpick comes out clean, place the cake on a wire rack to cool for about 10 minutes.
For caramel sauce, in a small saucepan, combine brown sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1 cup cold water until smooth. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.

Remove from the heat; stir in ¼ regular butter and vanilla until smooth. Serve with warm cake.

(optional) - Top cake with whipped cream.

title: Gingerbread Mini Cakes
description: This dish is great during the winter holidays. Pairs nicely with some Café de Cannabis.
directions:
In a medium size bowl, combine flax egg, water, hemp milk, molasses, and melted cannabis-infused coconut oil.

(note) - To make a flax egg, mix 1 tbsp ground flax seeds + 3 tbsp water in a small bowl.Allow mixture to thicken in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes before use.

Gradually add the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and stir until well combined.

(note) - The batter should be slightly runny.
Grease a griddle or pan with some cooking oil and warm up over medium heat to melt oil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and scoop the batter unto the griddle using approximately one tbsp of batter for each mini cake.
Let cook on one side until edges are bubbly and firm (about 3-5 minutes), flip and repeat until brown on the other side.
Serve hot!

title: Gnocchi in CannaButter
description: For those chefs are a bit more ambitious with their edibles dishes. A great way to impress your friends and family.
directions: Boil potatoes(skins on) in salted water until done.While hot, remove skins, then put potatoes through a sieve to insure no lumps.
Using a large wooden spoon, combine potatoes, egg, and baking powder until fairly well mixed together.
Flour a board, then mix and kneed the potato/flour mixture until it resembles bread dough.
Roll out a portion of dough to the width and length of a cigar and cut into 1in bits.

Place a fork upside down then roll the uncut side of the dough pieces over the fork. Roll one piece of dough at a time and cover the remaining portion to keep them from getting dry.

(note) - This is to add some small ridges to one side of the gnocchi.
Cook one or two pieces for about 4 minutes. Remove and taste them. They should be firm but not too hard.

When you have finished cutting all the pieces, place them on a floured board or cookie sheet and sprinkle lightly with flour.

(note) - These can be covered with a dish towel for use the same day or frozen on the cookie sheet, then placed in a plastic bag for future use.

If you are going to use them right away, boil some salted water in a large pot adding a tbsp of olive oil. Add the pieces of gnocchi. When they rise to the top of the water, cook for about five minutes. Gently pour into a large sieve or colander.
While still in the colander, rinse gnocchi under hot water to remove the flour you topped them with. This will keep them from sticking when you add the melted CannaButter and garlic mixture.
Heat a saucepan to medium heat and add a little coconut oil or olive oil with the CannaButter. Now add chopped garlic, browning lightly.

Slowly pour over the boiled gnocchi.

(optional) - Sprinkle well with grated Parmesan, Asiago, or Romano cheeses and add your favorite red sauce on the gnocchi after pouring the butter/garlic.

title: Golden Milk Snack Bites
description: These tasty golden bites are satisfying and quite healthy. Receive turmeric`s anti-inflammatory benefits with each bite.
directions: Add cashew butter to a medium mixing bowl along with maple syrup, hemp seeds, golden milk mix, and salt.Stir to combine.

Add CannaFlour a little at a time until a firm cookie dough consistency is reached.

(note) - Consistency should not be tacky or crumbly, and should be moldable into balls.
Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more golden milk mix for more spice or maple syrup for increased sweetness.
Add the softened CannaButter and stir it loosely into the dough.

Scoop out 1 tbsp amounts and gently roll into balls. Repeat until all dough is formed into all 12 balls.

(optional) - Roll in shredded coconut.
Refrigerate for 10-15 minutes to chill.

After chilling, top with melted CannaButter, then chill again for about 10 minutes.

(note) - The finished bites will keep stored in the refrigerator up to 1 week or in the freezer 1 month.

title: Grandma`s Yeast Rolls
description: Classic yeast rolls, just like grandma used to bake, taken to the next level with its cannabis-infused batter.
directions: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm milk(110-115° F).Add the sugar, applesauce, egg whites, salt and 2 cups CannaFlour; beat until smooth.Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.

Turn onto a lightly floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 6-8 minutes. Place in a bowl coated with cooking spray, turning once to coat top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and divide into 24 pieces. Shape each portion into an 8-inch rope and tie into a knot. Place on 2 baking sheets coated with cooking spray.
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.
Bake rolls until golden brown, 12-16 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks to cool.

title: Green Bean Casserole
description: Fresh green beans, mushrooms, and onion topped with french fried onions. This casserole works great as a side dish.
directions: Preheat oven to 375° F.Butter an 8 x 8 inch baking pan.

Heat a large pot of water to boiling over high heat. Add beans and cook for 3-4 minutes. Drain beans and set aside.

(note) - Beans should still be semi-crispy.
Melt the CannaButter and butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms and cook. Stir until softened, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and add the drained beans, cream of mushroom soup, ¾ cup of the french fried onions and salt and pepper.
Stir to combine and pour mixture into the prepared baking pan.
Top with remaining fried onions and bake for about 20 minutes or until heated though and beans are tender.

title: Green Dragon
description: If you are looking for the best way to enjoy cannabis and alcohol, you have found it! Just add this to any of your favorite drinks and prepare for a wild night.
directions:
Pour 8-9 oz vodka into the whipper.Add the cannabis into the whipper.

(note) - If you use⅓ of a bottle of vodka, then weigh out⅓ of an eighth of cannabis.

Attach the nitrous charger to the whipper and then release the gas. Unscrew the charger and attach the second charge and release the gas again. After the second charge, let it sit for a minute or two and then open it up.
Next, take out your double boiler. Heat the water in the lower part of the double boiler to around 200°F. Pour the infused alcohol into the top of the double boiler.

Simmer the alcohol at this temperature in the top of the double boiler for about 45 minutes.

(note) - This will reduce the mixture a bit, so add vodka to match whatever volume is lost in order to maintain the original volume.
Next, remove the top pot from the double boiler and set aside.

Using a glass-measuring cup, put a small metal strainer on top and then set some cheesecloth into the strainer. Pour the cannabis liquid into the glass-measuring cup and strain out the leftover cannabis.
After straining, add enough of vodka to bring it back to the original volume (250 ml).
Now you can use this liquid, Green Dragon, as a substitute for the base spirit in your favorite cocktail.

title: Grilled Cheese Crostini
description: Warm crunchy bread topped with creamy Brie cheese and a sweet strawberry mixture.
directions: Preheat the grill.
In a large bowl, toss the strawberries with 2 tbsp of the CannaOil, the balsamic vinegar, sugar and salt to combine. Set aside to macerate for 15-20 minutes.
Once the grill is hot, brush each piece of bread generously on both sides with the remaining CannaOil.
Grill the bread until nicely charred on both sides, about 2-3 minutes. Let cool slightly.
To serve, top each piece of bread with 3 tbsp of Brie and 2-3 tbsp of the strawberry mixture.
Finish with a sprinkle of mint and pinch of black pepper.
Serve immediately.

title: Grilled Corn on the Cob with CannaButter
description: The perfect picnic dish for the next adult gathering. Quick, tasty, and easy; what`s not to love?
directions: Preheat grill to 350°F.
Peel husks from the corn and remove any excess strings remaining from the husks.

Grill the prepared corn.

(note) - Turn the corn often so each ear of corn is evenly charred.
Remove the corn from the grill and slather each ear of corn with CannaButter. After evenly distributing the CannaButter, add your desired seasonings.

title: Grilled Fish Tacos
description: Delicate mahi-mahi topped with cannabis-infused chili salsa, sliced avocado, and crumbled queso fresco.
directions: In a medium pan, cook Anaheim chili, jalapeño, tomatillo, and onion over medium-hot heat until blackened on all sides. Remove hot chiles to a paper bag and close.
Let sit for 5 minutes. Run chilies under water to easily peel. Remove stems and seeds.

Transfer grilled chilies, onion and tomatillo to a food processor or blender with the garlic, cilantro, CannaOil, and lime juice. Process on high until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper and set aside.
Brush fish with oil and season with salt and pepper on both sides.
Grill fish over a medium-hot heat for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until done to your liking or fish flakes easily with a fork.
Heat tortillas for about 15 seconds per side over the grill.
Place a layer of shredded cabbage on each tortilla, top with grilled fish, chili salsa, sliced avocado, and crumbled cheese.
Serve immediately.

title: Guacamole
description: So versatile it can be used on most of your favorite dishes.
directions: Mash avocados in a bowl until creamy.
Mix tomatoes, CannaOil, onion, cilantro, lemon juice, and jalapeño pepper into mashed avocado until well combined, season with salt and black pepper.
Serve the cannabis-infused guacamole.

title: Hash Browns
description: Pair this dish with some scrambled eggs and you will have one hell of a wake and bake.
directions: In a medium bowl, beat the egg and mix in salt, pepper, garlic and potatoes.
Refrigerate for 60 minutes.
Take out the mixture and roll into balls, then set each ball aside.
Melt the CannaButter in a medium saucepan and fry the potato balls until golden brown.
Serve while hot.

title: Heady Eggnog
description: Classic wintertime drink with a modern twist-Weed Whiskey.
directions: Separate egg yolks and egg whites into two bowls.
Add sugar to the yolks and whisk rapidly for 2 minutes.
Add the heavy cream, vanilla extract and bourbon, and whisk until ingredients are distributed evenly.
Place the egg whites in a stand mixer and add salt. Whip mixture on high speed until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold stiff egg whites into the yolk mixture. Grate nutmeg into the mixture while folding.
Refrigerate one hour and serve with grated nutmeg on top.

title: Highland Latte
description: Enjoy this creamy adult beverage by the fire, paired with a cannabis-infused doughnut.
directions: Separate egg whites from yolk.Pour yolk into glass.Cover and shake.
Add CannaScotch.
Add Cynar and Punt e Mes.
Add a dash of bitters.
Pour in egg whites.
Add ice. Cover and shake.
Strain into latte mug. Add a dash of bitters and swirl.

title: Homemade Cheese Crackers
description: Golden brown Parmesan and cheddar cheese crackers. The ideal snack for those on the move.
directions: Preheat the oven to 425° F.Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.

In the bowl of a food processor, pulse the CannaFlour with the salt, cayenne pepper, cheddar and Parmesan to combine. Add the CannaButter and pulse until the mixture resembles a coarse meal, 1-2 minutes.
Add the water and mix until the dough forms a ball around the blade. If the dough looks dry, add more water, 1-2 tbsp at a time.
Divide the dough into two pieces. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to ¼ inch thick. Cut into 1-inch squares and transfer to the prepared baking sheets.
Using the point of a small knife or the tine of a fork, poke a hole into the center of each cracker. Bake the crackers until golden brown and crisp, 14-16 minutes.

Cool completely before serving.

(note) - The finished crackers will keep, stored in an airtight container at room temperature, for up to a week.

title: Homemade Gummies
description: Gummies that will have you pondering the reason your did not try this sooner.
directions: Turn your stove on low heat.In a pot add the water, cannabis-infused coconut oil, and sunflower lecithin.

Continue stirring the mixture until it has a consistent texture and the coconut oil has completely melted. Now, add in the flavored gelatin and the unflavored gelatin while continuing to stir throughout this process.

Whisk extensively on low heat for 10-15 minutes until the gelatin is completely dissolved. Make sure it does not come to a boil; make sure that all the ingredients are thoroughly combined.

(note) - Do not stop stirring this mixture for the entire 15 minutes.

While leaving the pot on low heat, start filling up the gummy bear molds with a dropper (a dropper is a mini turkey baster that comes with most gummy bear molds).

(note) - Make sure to move quickly. If your liquid starts to separate, it`s because the mixture has started to cool. It`s critical that you move fast otherwise the oil may separate in the pot. You need to continue whisking throughout the pouring process otherwise the mixture may start to harden and stop binding.
Put the gummy bear molds into the freezer for 20-25 minutes.

title: Homemade Hard Candy
description: Get faded while you  satisfy your sweet tooth.
directions: Combine in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat sugar, light corn syrup, and filtered water.
Stir until sugar is completely dissolved.
Once boiling, insert a candy thermometer. Do not stir after your mixture starts to boil.
When your thermometer reads 300°F, immediately remove from heat; keep your thermometer in the pot.

When the temperature drops to 250°F, stir in orange or lemon flavor, and cannabis tincture.

(note) - If orange or lemon is not your desired flavor, then replace with what you prefer.
Carefully pour into lollipop molds or candy molds.
Allow to cool completely at room temperature for about 15-20 minutes.
Store in an airtight container.

title: Hot Chocolate
description: Cozy up to the fire with cannabis and hot chocolate.
directions:
Heat CannaMilk and milk in saucepan on medium heat for 2 mins.

(note) - Replace regular milk with CannaMilk to increase potency.
Mix in chocolate, sugar, and cinnamon.

Return to heat and cook on medium for 3-4 minutes or until foamy.

(note) - Do not let mixture boil.

Whisk until smooth and pour into 3 mugs.

(optional) - Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon & 2 tbsp of whip cream.

title: Hummus
description: Use this tasty dip with pita, crackers, or on sandwiches. Customize this recipe to your liking; adding chili flakes is always a good idea.
directions: In a blender or food processor, combine lemon juice and tahini. Blend for 30 seconds.
Add chickpeas, garlic, CannaOil, cumin, and 2 tbsp of water. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute.\n\n(note) - Add more water as necessary until you reach desired consistency.
Pour hummus mixture into a bowl and stir.
Serve immediately or refrigerate.

title: Iced Coffee
description: Great for a pick-me-up on a hot day. Cool down while you get high.
directions: In a small bowl, stir together the water and instant coffee.
In a blender, combine ice cubes, coffee mixture, CannaMilk, sweetened condensed milk, and chocolate syrup. Blend until smooth.
Pour and enjoy!

title: Italian Dressing
description: A simple recipe for your next salad. Stay healthy, while still receiving your medication.
directions: Combine all ingredients in a mason jar.
Close lid tightly and shake vigorously for 15 seconds.

Serve immediately or store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

(note) - Always shake before serving.

title: Jalapeño Poppers
description: Spicy jalapeño peppers stuffed with a cannabis cream cheese mixture and topped with CannaButter Panko crumbs.
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a baking sheet and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine the Parmesan cheese, cannabis cream cheese, crumbled bacon, chives, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Using kitchen gloves or a plastic grocery sack to protect your hands, halve each jalapeño lengthwise. Remove seeds and membranes using a paring knife.
Spoon cheese mixture evenly into each jalapeño half.
Melt CannaButter and pour over Panko. Toss to coat. Sprinkle evenly over each jalapeño popper.

Place the peppers, cut side up, on a baking sheet and bake on the bottom rack until the cheese has melted, jalapeños have softened and Panko is golden brown.

(note) - It will take about 30 minutes for the poppers to be ready.
Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

title: Kief Fried Chicken
description: This modern twist on fried chicken will have you wishing you knew of this recipe sooner. Be careful, this recipe will leave you heavily medicated.
directions: Preheat your oven to 220° F.
Take a baking sheet and line it with parchment paper that will not burn in the oven. Very carefully sprinkle the kief onto the sheet making sure that it is evenly disbursed.
Place the baking sheet into the oven uncovered and heat for 25 minutes. Pull the baking sheet from the oven, and let it cool completely.
Mix the decarboxylated kief with the chili powder and divide it into 8 servings with a scale.
In a medium bowl whisk the eggs and milk together.
In a different medium bowl pour in the self-rising flour, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, chili powder, and sea salt.
Cut the chicken breasts into 16 even strips.
Take your chicken strips one at a time and dredge it fully into the dry mixture. Shake any excess flour off of the tender.
Next, drop the chicken tender into the bowl of egg mixture. Pull the chicken tender out and let any extra egg drip off.
Then return the chicken strip back to the flour and fully cover the entire strip until evenly coated.

Fill a small pot up half way with peanut oil and heat to 350°F.

(note) - Keep a temperature gauge in the pot to make sure the temperature does not rise above 350°F.
